definitions.definition: to talk or write about something in a very enthusiastic way

examples.text: The critics raved about his performance in ‘Hamlet’.
Luke was still raving about the beauty of the desert.
‘He is the best American comedian since Jack Lemmon,’ raved Newsweek.

definitions.definition: to shout in a loud and emotional way at somebody because you are angry with them; to talk or shout in a way that is not logical or sensible
definitions.sensetop: rave at somebodyrave on (at somebody) (about something)+ speech

examples.text: She was shouting and raving at them.
My parents both raved at me.
He wandered the streets raving at passers-by.
He was still raving on about irresponsible youngsters.
‘Never mind how he feels!’ Melissa raved.

definitions.definition: to show that you are angry by shouting or complaining loudly for a long time

examples.text: She was ranting and raving about our stupidity.

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘show signs of madness’): probably from Old Northern French raver; related obscurely to (Middle) Low German reven ‘be senseless, rave’.
